intro: Amitostigma lepidum, commonly known as the silverleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silvery coating, giving it its common name. Amitostigma lepidum is often found in open meadows and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
